result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan J Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV and DNA surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
Pay supervision fees.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  No contact with the children that does not comply with the Family Court orders.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan J Weber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PROBATION REVIEW HEARING Transcript (5 pages) commencing 12/08/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Nathan J Weber in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Agent appeared by phone.  
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Nathan J Weber in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.    Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
.
Parties wish to proceed to sentencing.
.

  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing. Additional statements by:  Sarah P. and John W.
  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for -0- days served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 16 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.  No contact with the childen that does not comply with the Family Court orders.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV and DNA surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Nathan J Weber in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a plea hearing.
Defense is requesting another plea hearing date in Branch 36.
Defense request for a no violent contact order is denied by the court.  The victim was not present in court.
  Plea hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

for modification of bail received and filed.
cab

Defendant Nathan J Weber in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested a porjected guilty plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 36.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court VACATED pretrial date of 7/23/2015 on 7/15/2015.

Defendant Nathan J Weber in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs. Owen Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status conference. Defense counsel request matter be set for pretrial conference. State advised it will argue joinder on next court date.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Court VACATED pretrial conference date of 7/23/2015.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
UPON COURT'S SUGGESTION CASE IS TAGGING ALONG WITH NEW CASE 15CF2298 SET FOR BAIL BOND HEARING 7/15/15 AT 08:30 AM.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sarah P, and the minor children CEP-W, SLP-W and LLP-W.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nathan J Weber in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Nathan J Weber in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
